SEARCH
Package mz

Interface SelectionInterface<T extends Comparable>

Type Parameters:
T - setting of a type based on which the elements can be sorted.
All Superinterfaces:
Sort<T>, SortFind<T>, SortSwap<T>
All Known Implementing Classes:
Bubble, Cocktail, Comb, DoubleSelection, Gnome, IntroBubble, IntroCocktail, IntroComb, IntroDoubleSelection, IntroDPQBubble, IntroDPQCocktail, IntroDPQComb, IntroDPQDoubleSelection, IntroDPQGnome, IntroDPQOddEven, IntroDPQSelection, IntroGnome, IntroOddEven, IntroSelection, OddEven, Selection
public interface SelectionInterface<T extends Comparable> extends Sort<T>, SortSwap<T>, SortFind<T>
SelectionInterface, containing the methods of Selection Sort to implement other classes.
Since:
1.0

  • Method Details

    • selectionInc

      default void selectionInc(T[] array)
      selectionInc that performs the Selection Sort algorithm on an array of Comparable objects. The sorting is done in ascending order.
      • The method takes in an array of Comparable objects, array, and performs the Selection Sort algorithm on it.
      • The method starts by defining the length of the array as n.
      • The outer loop runs from 0 to (n - 1) and represents the current position of the sorted portion of the array.
      • Inside the outer loop, an integer variable index is initialized with the value of i. This index represents the index of the minimum element in the unsorted portion of the array.
      • The inner loop runs from (i + 1) to (n - 1) and iterates over the remaining unsorted portion of the array.
      • Inside the inner loop, the minIndex method is called to find the index of the minimum element between the current index j and the current minimum index index.
      • After the inner loop completes, the minimum element in the unsorted portion of the array is found, and its index is stored in index.
      • The swap method is called to swap the elements at indices index and i. This places the minimum element in its correct sorted position.
      • The process repeats until the entire array is sorted.
      selectionInc method implements the Selection Sort algorithm to sort the given array of Comparable objects in ascending order. It iterates through the array, finds the minimum element in the unsorted portion, and swaps it with the element at the current position in the sorted portion. This process is repeated until the array is fully sorted.
      Parameters:
      array - to be arranged.
      See Also:
      • SortFind.findMinimumIndex(Comparable[], int, int)
      • SortSwap.swap(Comparable[], int, int)

    • selectionDec

      default void selectionDec(T[] array)
      selectionDec that performs the Selection Sort algorithm on an array of Comparable objects. The sorting is done in descending order.
      • The method takes in an array of Comparable objects, array, and performs the Selection Sort algorithm on it.
      • The method starts by defining the length of the array as n.
      • The outer loop runs from 0 to (n - 1) and represents the current position of the sorted portion of the array.
      • Inside the outer loop, an integer variable index is initialized with the value of i. This index represents the index of the maximum element in the unsorted portion of the array.
      • The inner loop runs from (i + 1) to (n - 1) and iterates over the remaining unsorted portion of the array.
      • Inside the inner loop, the maxIndex method is called to find the index of the maximum element between the current index j and the current maximum index index.
      • After the inner loop completes, the maximum element in the unsorted portion of the array is found, and its index is stored in index.
      • The swap method is called to swap the elements at indices index and i. This places the maximum element in its correct sorted position.
      • The process repeats until the entire array is sorted.
      selectionDec method implements the Selection Sort algorithm to sort the given array of Comparable objects in descending order. It iterates through the array, finds the maximum element in the unsorted portion, and swaps it with the element at the current position in the sorted portion. This process is repeated until the array is fully sorted.
      Parameters:
      array - to be arranged.
      See Also:
      • SortFind.findMaximumIndex(Comparable[], int, int)
      • SortSwap.swap(Comparable[], int, int)

    • selectionInc

      default void selectionInc(T[] array, int left, int right)
      selectionInc that performs the Selection Sort algorithm on an array of Comparable objects. The sorting is done in ascending order.
      • The method takes in an array of Comparable objects, array, and performs the Selection Sort algorithm on it.
      • The method starts the left of the array as right.
      • The outer loop runs from left to (right - 1) and represents the current position of the sorted portion of the array.
      • Inside the outer loop, an integer variable index is initialized with the value of i. This index represents the index of the minimum element in the unsorted portion of the array.
      • The inner loop runs from (i + 1) to (right - 1) and iterates over the remaining unsorted portion of the array.
      • Inside the inner loop, the minIndex method is called to find the index of the minimum element between the current index j and the current minimum index index.
      • After the inner loop completes, the minimum element in the unsorted portion of the array is found, and its index is stored in index.
      • The swap method is called to swap the elements at indices index and i. This places the minimum element in its correct sorted position.
      • The process repeats until the entire array is sorted.
      selectionInc method implements the Selection Sort algorithm to sort the given array of Comparable objects in ascending order. It iterates through the array, finds the minimum element in the unsorted portion, and swaps it with the element at the current position in the sorted portion. This process is repeated until the array is fully sorted.
      Parameters:
      array - to be arranged.
      left - The starting index of the subarray to be sorted.
      right - The ending index (exclusive) of the subarray to be sorted.
      See Also:
      • SortFind.findMinimumIndex(Comparable[], int, int)
      • SortSwap.swap(Comparable[], int, int)

    • selectionDec

      default void selectionDec(T[] array, int left, int right)
      selectionDec that performs the Selection Sort algorithm on an array of Comparable objects. The sorting is done in descending order.
      • The method takes in an array of Comparable objects, array, and performs the Selection Sort algorithm on it.
      • The method starts the left of the array as right.
      • The outer loop runs from left to (right - 1) and represents the current position of the sorted portion of the array.
      • Inside the outer loop, an integer variable index is initialized with the value of i. This index represents the index of the maximum element in the unsorted portion of the array.
      • The inner loop runs from (i + 1) to (right - 1) and iterates over the remaining unsorted portion of the array.
      • Inside the inner loop, the maxIndex method is called to find the index of the maximum element between the current index j and the current maximum index index.
      • After the inner loop completes, the maximum element in the unsorted portion of the array is found, and its index is stored in index.
      • The swap method is called to swap the elements at indices index and i. This places the maximum element in its correct sorted position.
      • The process repeats until the entire array is sorted.
      selectionDec method implements the Selection Sort algorithm to sort the given array of Comparable objects in descending order. It iterates through the array, finds the maximum element in the unsorted portion, and swaps it with the element at the current position in the sorted portion. This process is repeated until the array is fully sorted.
      Parameters:
      array - to be arranged.
      left - The starting index of the subarray to be sorted.
      right - The ending index (exclusive) of the subarray to be sorted.
      See Also:
      • SortFind.findMaximumIndex(Comparable[], int, int)
      • SortSwap.swap(Comparable[], int, int)
